data.enText: Our firm is well placed to grab a large slice of the market.

a fish slice
a stroke that makes the ball spin to one side rather than going straight ahead

to cut sth into slices
to slice (up) onions
Slice the cucumber thinly.
a sliced loaf
to cut sth easily with or as if with a sharp blade

data.chText: 他不小心把指头割破了。
data.enText: He accidentally sliced through his finger.

data.chText: 一块玻璃划破他的肩膀。
data.enText: A piece of glass sliced into his shoulder.

data.chText: 她一席话把整个事态的一切纷扰剖析得清清楚楚。
data.enText: Her speech sliced through all the confusion surrounding the situation.

data.chText: 那把刀划破了他的上衣。
data.enText: The knife sliced his jacket.
The ship sliced the water.
to hit a ball so that it spins and does not move in the expected direction
He managed to slice a shot over the net.
to hit the ball so that it flies away in a curve, when you do not mean to
to reduce sth by a large amount

data.chText: 由于征收新税，年度红利减少了30%。
data.enText: The new tax has sliced annual bonuses by 30 percent.
any way you slice it
however you choose to look at a situation
slice sth↔off/away
slice sth off sth
to cut sth from a larger piece
Slice a piece off.

data.chText: 他把世界纪录缩短了两秒。
data.enText: He sliced two seconds off the world record.

tr: a golf shot that curves to the right for a right-handed golfer
example: he took lessons to cure his slicing

tr: a spatula for spreading paint or ink
a serving that has been cut from a larger portion
a thin flat piece cut off of some object

example: a slice of the company's revenue
he put a bandage over the cut

tr: hit a ball so that it causes a backspin
hit a ball and put a spin on it so that it travels in a different direction

value.def: A slice of bread, meat, fruit, or other food is a thin piece that has been cut from a larger piece.

example.ex: Try to eat at least four slices of bread a day.
example.tran: 每天尽量至少吃 4 片面包。

example.ex: ...water flavored with a slice of lemon.
example.tran: 加了一片柠檬调味的水

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: If you slice bread, meat, fruit, or other food, you cut it into thin pieces.

example.ex: Slice the steak into long thin slices.
example.tran: 将牛排切成长长的薄片。

example.ex: He began slicing the pie up.

value.def: You can use slice to refer to a part of a situation or activity.

example.ex: Fiction takes up a large slice of the publishing market.
example.tran: 小说在出版市场上占了很大的份额。

example.ex: ...a car that represents a slice of motoring history.
example.tran: 一辆代表了一段汽车发展史的轿车

value.def: In tennis, golf, and other sports, if you slice a ball, you hit its edge rather than its centre, so that it travels at an angle.

example.ex: The captain swung his left foot, but sliced the ball wide.
example.tran: 队长飞起左脚一踢，球却侧着旋出去老远。

example.ex: ...a ball that would reduce hooks and slices.
example.tran: 一只能够减少左曲球和侧旋球的球

value.tran: (网球、高尔夫球等中)曲打，斜击，使(球)侧旋

value.def: If something slices through a substance, it moves through it quickly, like a knife.

example.ex: The ship sliced through the water.
